Comments_List: This was a really great class! I learned a lot about the synthesis and spectroscopic properties of nanomaterialsp
This class was great! I learned how to build and use a microscope for the first time as well as analyze the organic materials created in the first part of the lab.
The course is  s very time consuming and the lectures feel unnecessary
Both Dr. Parr and Professor Ganim are wonderful professors. They are very understanding and explain the labs very clearly.
I would recommend this class to a chem major who needs an advanced lab.

CHEM 335L is an awesome lab course!! it was nice to have small lab sections, and the experiments we did were really interesting. learning about the principles behind quantum dots, SEM imaging, single molecule fluorescence, optical trapping, etc. were great. the second half of the course was a little less organized than the first - lab report grading came back later, and the lab handouts were comprehensive but sometimes a little unclear/confusing in the directions. but overall, it was so enjoyable to learn about these advanced materials chemistry and biophysical techniques. make sure you budget more time than you think for the lab reports - they take time!
